intro: Thlaspi perfoliatum var. stylatum, commonly known as the slender peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other cruciferous plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, rounded leaves that often have a slightly succulent texture. Its flowers are typically small, white or pale yellow, and arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. This variety is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
